docs.snippet: Messaging apps with a multitude of features, such as mobile payment portals and games, can walk a fine line between convenient and overwhelming....

docs.abstract: Molly Wood Machine Learning column observes that Facebook's announcement about opening its Messenger apps for developers to build new features reflects trend toward messaging apps that offer variety of services; notes that trend originated with Chinese and Japanese messaging giants WeChat and Line, which have managed to offer more powerful apps that avoid pitfall of overwhelming users.

headline.main: Messaging Apps Offer Do-It-All Services in Bid for Higher Profits
